body: @aaltay @lukecwik @robertwb Can you please take a look!

R: @lukecwik Please merge! Thank you.
The commit has been updated and the changes applied to the correct new file.

Note that I haven't done any testing of the docker container, or appropriate population of some fields, or made sure that some of the fields match the container contract (with/without the `ProvisionInfo`)
Is there something further to do on this one?

I'm wary about `setup.py` because "actually programming" in builds is one of the worst sources of unpredictable maintenance burdens, but let's just get this in and iterate because it is definitely useful immediately. The gradle failure is [BEAM-3605](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEAM-3605).
R: @kennknowles could you take a look if this makes sense?
@akedin @kennknowles It's green finally and already to merge.

Hi @chamikaramj. Ive implemented the feedback items, but it seems that even after rebasing my repo, any time I open/reopen this pull request that commits that have already been merged show up in the commit section. Any advice on how to fix this? Thanks
@XuMingmin Do you have that test as a nicely isolated thing that I could run so that we can debug this?
Thanks a lot for working on this!  I just merged.
Requested reviews from just a couple folks in the right arenas rather than targeting the authors of every touched piece of code.
I suggest to re-create the pull request from scratch, by cherry-picking (`git cherry-pick`) the commit with the desired part of your change onto the master branch.
Yeah, probably re-creating the PR is the easiest way out. Please follow instructions in https://beam.apache.org/contribute/contribution-guide/.
Alternatively, we could keep the current Gradle output format (`harness-<VERSION>`) and change `copyDockerfilDependencies` to match this.
This currently depends on #4598 because I needed to fix the gradle build in order to test this. This can be removed before submitting.

Thanks! I will merge it. I have two comments to follow up.

---

Reviewed 10 of 10 files at r1.
Review status: all files reviewed at latest revision, 2 unresolved discussions.

---

*[sdks/java/extensions/sql/src/main/java/org/apache/beam/sdk/extensions/sql/impl/transform/BeamAggregationTransforms.java, line 158 at r1](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/apache/beam/4466#-L4bKH803m5IKeOiX0vS:-L4bKH803m5IKeOiX0vT:b-br3yn0) ([raw file](https://github.com/apache/beam/blob/94fd067d2e0f706ae489d68246d9d43bde8af895/sdks/java/extensions/sql/src/main/java/org/apache/beam/sdk/extensions/sql/impl/transform/BeamAggregationTransforms.java#L158)):*
> ```Java
>     extends CombineFn<BeamRecord, AggregationAccumulator, BeamRecord> {
>     private List<CombineFn> aggregators;
>     private List<Object> sourceFieldExps;
> ```

I think that actually a `List<List<BeamSqlInputRefExpression>>` is more clear here as a "list of args". We then probably do want to have optimized coder representations for the 1 & 2 argument cases, just like you have done. Since I don't have a precise suggestion let's just keep in mind to follow up.

---

*[sdks/java/extensions/sql/src/main/java/org/apache/beam/sdk/extensions/sql/impl/transform/agg/CovarianceFn.java, line 100 at r1](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/apache/beam/4466#-L4bLn0zZm2UFCjSCAXN:-L4bLn0zZm2UFCjSCAXO:bmut4vv) ([raw file](https://github.com/apache/beam/blob/94fd067d2e0f706ae489d68246d9d43bde8af895/sdks/java/extensions/sql/src/main/java/org/apache/beam/sdk/extensions/sql/impl/transform/agg/CovarianceFn.java#L100)):*
> ```Java
>     public Coder<CovarianceAccumulator> getAccumulatorCoder(CoderRegistry registry,
>                                                           Coder<KV<T, T>> inputCoder) {
>         return SerializableCoder.of(CovarianceAccumulator.class);
> ```

Using a `SerializableCoder` in a `CombineFn` may result in a lot of extra data getting shuffled. It is better to have some functionality, but then let's consider making a custom coder here.

---


*Comments from [Reviewable](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/apache/beam/4466#-:-L4bMAnMdcIvs6zg4eky:b-72wc4d)*
<!-- Sent from Reviewable.io -->
It may be more idiomatic to use a build property (`-P`) rather than a system property (`-D`).
Since 4598 was merged, can you rebase on top of apache/master?
Retest this please. (this triggers a test on Jenkins)

Gradle failure seems unrelated. 

Jenkins: run python postcommit

Seems that the PR currently doesn't compile.
Known flake in gradle build. I don't think we should hold up the proto changes for that.

Can you please merge?

CC: @robertwb (this blocks direct / fnapi runner migration)
Rebased, squashed, fixed javadoc link error. Will get to green.
One should not have to specify streaming mode to use SDFs. We should instead inspect if there are any SDFs before using the Fn Api Runner (until SDFs are supported over the Fn Api Runner of course).
Were you able to figure this out?
I chatted with Robert--we should not hard-code `--is_streaming`, since we should support SDFs in batch mode as well.  Accordingly, I am closing this PR.
Gradle failure was a known flake. I will try to spend a minute and sickbay these known issues. I filed them a bit ago to see if natural owners wanted to fix.
@XuMingmin replied to @jkff question above. I think it is safe and recommended. I can remove the change to coder if that is better.

Adding also a reviewer with Python expertise:
r: @charlesccychen
These test failures appear to be unrelated.
@robertwb Can you please have a look?
